intro: Eriosema lateriticola, commonly known as the lateritic eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy foliage and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, arid environments. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, and it produces small leguminous pods that contain seeds. Eriosema lateriticola is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
